column1: short of a length, not much width, chops  a flat-batted slap into the surface
short of a length, tucked off the pads to deep fine leg
short of a length, gets big on him outside off and he slashes at it. A thick outside edge goes through where second slip would have been
length ball on off, punched towards mid-off
shortish, sitting up nicely around off, Dunk stands tall in the crease and muscles a pull through midwicket for the first boundary of the match
fullish length outside off, mistimes a drive to mid-off
short of a length, down the leg side
scorching short ball outside off, holds its line and bounces considerably, sticks the bat out and gets beaten
length ball, tucked into midwicket
short of a length, nips away outside off, flicks against the line to midwicket
is that a drop. Crunches a drive straight back and doesn't keep it down. Sandhu sticks the right hand out but can't latch on. Hit extremely forcefully
short of a length, straightening down the leg-stump channel, flicked behind square
short of a length, angling in on leg, tucked to midwicket
full on the pads, gets down on one knee and crunches a sweep to deep fine leg
oh, stunning placement. There is a backward square leg and a fine leg and he has neatly split both with this sweep
length ball on middle and off, punched down to long-on
fullish on leg stump, tries to heave it away and gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
. Floats up a full toss that's been swept uppishly through backward square leg. Wide of the fielder
a full ball, Dunk tries to clip it but the ball stops on him a bit and he chips it in the air as mid-on settles under it
fullish, nips away from outside off, Handscomb sticks the bat out and gets beaten
full,shaping away outside off, driven into the covers
short of a length on middle, punched down the ground to mid-on
gets a lot of shape away but it needs to be full to trouble the batsman.Not short like this as Handscomb slaps it away through point
short of a length around the fifth-stump channel, sticks the bat out and the ball nips away late to beat the outside edge
short of good length outside off, stands tall in the crease and punches down the ground
similar length but a lot straighter on off, defended off the backfoot towards mid-off
slightly fuller - a length ball outside off, crunchily punches away to mid--off
chipped in the air and in front of mid-on. A fuller ball that he drills down the ground. The fielder there nails a direct hit with Handscomb backing away but he's managed to slide the bat back in
short of good length outside off, whips it away to midwicket
sprayed down the leg side, Pietersen tries to clip and misses
short of a length outside off, Pietersen crunches a pull through midwicket. Deep square leg runs and dives across to his left but cannot stop the ball from crossing the boundary
back of a length on off, keeps it out into the leg side
short ball, well outside off, fetches a pull and gets a top-edge as the ball goes one-bounce over the deep midwicket boundary
this one's better or is it? Not as well-timed. Just comes down the track and punches this one after meeting the pitch straight down the ground
outside edge that gets past the diving keeper. Pietersen plays at a wide one and loses shape as he throws hard hands. Lenton flings himself to his right full-length but the ball gets past him
short of a length on off, gets a stride forward and whips it to to deep backward square leg
tries to heave a fuller one and gets it away to backward square leg off the inside of the bat
fetches a sweep from outside off and knocks it away to deep backward square

Lenton excitedly appeals for a catch and Pietersen stands his ground. The umpire gives it out. Pietersen swings big across the line.This one's pushed across and he is expecting it to spin into him.But it simply keeps getting away from him as it comes on with the arm and takes the outside edge
fullish, pitching outside leg, punched away to mid-on
slid across outside off, hangs the bat out after half a stride across and gets an outside edgetowards backward point
too full on the stumps, drilled between mid-on and midwicket
leg-side length ball, pats it into the leg side for one

oh, what a dream delivery> Is that the ball of the season or what? Maxwell has no clue about it. He's drawn forward by a length ball and the ball spins into him to beat the inside edge and clatter into the stumps
short, spinning away with some bounce, beaten
full on the stumps, clipped through midwicket
fuller around off, driven down to long-off
full and flat on middle, drilled towards mid-on
short of a length on off, backs away and pats it away to deep point
shortish outside off, waits for it before opening the face to third man
that hits a poor, harmless bird. Short of a length on off, Handscomb slaps and the ball hits the bird flush and hard before it can take flight. Clips a wing off
short of good length and accurate on the stumps, punched back
advances down the ground but the length is shortish and he punches into the covers
advances down the ground to meet the pitch and drills a drive extremely hard past mid-off diving to his right
shortish and spinning away, slapped out to deep point
shortish, pitches outside leg, turns it away to deep fine leg and the man inside the circle pulls it back
back of a length, shifts back and drops it in front of midwicket
looped up on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
punched down to long-on
Good length on middle, slower ball, clipped off his hips to deep midwicket
Full and wide outside off, enough width to cut this square to the man in the deep
Full and wide outside off, punched off the back foot to cover point
Good length on middle stump, tapped off the back foot to cover
width offered outside off, goes back and clears his front leg, but can't time it well. Hit back past the bowler
full on middle, dances down the wicket and drives to Rohrer at mid off. Well stopped
full on off stump, too close to his body for the cut, chopped to point
good length on leg stump, but going down the leg side. Extras
full on off stump, prods forward and turns this towards the leg side with soft hands
full on off stump, driven back past the non striker to long on
full on middle, but it's the other one. Going down the leg side, and helped on it's way to short fine leg
the extra ball hurts them! Short on middle, and pulled off the back foot to the cow corner boundary.
slower ball short outside off, chopped down to third man. Played late
good length on middle stump, stays back and punched off the back foot to mid on. Off the top half of the bat
extra short on middle stump, but slower ball. Drags his pull to midwicket. Checks his shot
good length on middle stump, comes down the wicket and punches past extra cover
good length on middle stump, turned off his pads to square leg
good length on middle, carved off the back foot. Beats cover, and there's his fifty!
tries to pat this away but the line is leg-sidish and tucks him up
tries to carve out a drive to one that's slid across and gets beaten
full down the leg side, clipped away to deep backward square leg
shifts back to a length ball and flicks it to deep midwicket
full toss, slapped down to long-on
waits and gets on top of this length ball before opening the face to short third man
fuller ball, walks across and flicks it to midwicket
short ball, pitches outside leg, gets in position early and times a pull well through backward square leg

tries to repeat the same stroke but this one's slanted across him. He's perhaps too much leg side of it and skews it in the air off the toe end of the bat in the air. McClenaghan runs back and snaffles it smartly with a dive forward
short of a length, punched to long-on
full, pushed across, driven through the covers. Sandhu is casual in coming to the ball and allows a second run that should never have been there
fails to get on top of a short ball entirely and chops a cut into the surface
comes down the ground and launches it over extra cover's head
floats it up enough to draw him forward and fires it on a length,jabbed into the covers
full on the pads, clipped off them to deep midwicket
full outside off, meets the pitch and flicks it with the turn to midwicket. Seems like a wrong'un
extra bounce, smashes into the keeper's hemlet. A wrong'un that draws Faulkner forward and beats him before just kicking up from a length to hit the grill
short and wide, slapped out through point
sees the batsman advancing and drags the length back, slapped to sweeper cover
full, way outside ff. Gotch gets the front leg out and shovels it straight over. A powerful, full-blooded swing of the arms. Massive hit
short and wide, bounces extra and drifts away to leave him beaten on the cut
short ball, slapped straight into the hands of point. That's catching practice for Khawaja. He had rolled his fingers over the seam, and Gotch doesn't the drop in pace
slower full ball, chips a push towards point
slower back of a length ball, swing and a miss away from the body
gets down to sweep but the ball drifts down the leg side to short fine leg
jabs the bat down to force a cut and gets beaten outside off
swings across the line and the ball goes straight through. Full and straight, Faulkner expects it to be slanted across more to give him the room as he misses and the ball smashes into the stumps
full and pushed across, fetches a sweep from outside off to midwicket
yorks him lots of loop and flight on leg, squeezed back
swipes for a big slog and the ball takes the inside edge to miss the leg stump and go to short fine leg
pats it away in front of deep backward point. Played gently and they push back for the second
short, outside off, slapped down to long-on
full, outside off, taps it down to long-off
reaches out to a slower ball and taps it to point
short, tries to get on top of the bounce and slaps it to long-on
short, gets big on him, drags a pull off the toe end to long-on
full, fired wide outside off
short of a length, fetches a pull and gets a bottom edge to midwicket
short ball, pulls it away through midwicket. McClenaghan at deep backward square leg is late to pick it up and the ball beats him as he comes running to his left
full,wide, teasing the umpire on the popping crease, inside it though
fuller, hammered down to long-on for one
short, wide, slapped square of the wicket through the right of point
closes the face early looking for a clip and pushes it back to the bowler off the splice
full on the pads, clipped off them between deep midwicket and long-on
full outside off, and Uzi bangs it square off the front foot, crisply hit and beats the man at cover. Races away to the deep extra boundary
full outside off, but swinging in this time, forces the mistimed drive. Straight to cover now
good length on middle stump, swings into the batsman and eventually down the leg side, misses the flick shot but brushes his pads, races away to the fine-leg boundary.
good length ball, starts on off stump but finishes on middle, clipped off his pads to deep midwicket
starts off with a wayward delivery to the right-handed bat. Full on middle and leg, and going down the leg side. Diving stop from the keeper
full outside off, and swings away from the right hander, too much movement in fact. Goes over the tramlines
full on middle stump, worked off his toes to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, nips back slightly, cramps the batsman. Can't hit this away. Smacks him near the gut instead
good length on off stump, nipping into the right hander, chopped into the surface off the back foot by Vince
wayward. Good length outside leg side and going further down. Uncontrolled movement
back of a length on middle stump, stays deep in his crease and turned to square leg for a quick run
good length but wide outside off, Khawaja shimmies down the wicket and slaps this square, straight to cover point
full outside off, mistimed on drive to mid on's right, they scamper through for the run
beautiful! Full on off stump, and angling across Vince instead of coming back in. Tries to flick towards the leg side, but plays it inside the line of the ball. Zips through to the keeper
maximum! Full on off stump, and he dances down the wicket to generate some extra momentum. Smacked over mid off, and it's fallen beyond the ropes! Flat!
advances down the ground to a shortish ball and swings and misses looking for a slap

clumsy from short fine leg. Khawaja walks across to a length ball and scoops it past the right of the keeper. Short fine moves to his left in time but just doesn't bend low enough to stop a ball that was very stoppable
width outside off, reaches out and responds with a booming drive over the point region
oh, these are stunning shots. They are expertly manipulating the field here. Short of a length, angling in, backs away and helps it along with a neat tuck through backward square leg
short of good length and angling in, same shot, same region, Tucked off the hips to the right of backward square leg
drilled back to the bowler
full, well outside off, driven to long-off
short of good length, pulled through midwicket
confuses the bowler by sliding the backfoot out and ends up staying put.Faulkner overadjusts his line and fires it full and wide, and it's creamed over the covers
now he walks across and exposes the stumps. Faulkner attacks it and pitches it up on them but Vince glances it very fine
short of a length, slanted across outside off, keeps a little low as well. Beaten
looks for another late glance and the ball clips the pad before going to short fine leg
length ball, outside off, slower ball and Khawaja has so much time he could got down for a short nap on the pitch and still got up in time to swat it away. Scooped through fine leg
gets the backfoot out of the way and slaps it straight over. Too short and too straight
another hat-trick of fours. How many more of these are we going to see today? Advances down the ground, makes room, and slaps it over the in-field at the cover region
backs away and the bowler slides a fuller ball into the pads that's clipped away to square leg
advances down the ground, slower at 102ks, pushed back off the inside of the bat
length ball, no pace again, walks across and punches it back. Successive dots. How stunning!
full, outside off, it kind of dips on him and he swishes way away from the body and gets beaten
edged and drops short. Again makes no effort to get behind the line and swings away from the body
back-of-the-hand slower ball, full on off, driven down to mid-on
advances down the ground and hammers a drive straight to mid-off
short of a length, pitches outside leg, backs away and punches it to cover
short of a length, swats it around the corner to short fine leg
full on off, looped up, closes the face and pops up a leading edge in front of short third man
advances down the ground to a full toss and punches it away through the cover and point region
down the track and inside-out over the covers
full and looped up on the pads, clips the pads and goes behind square
full, slanted across, crashes it out to the covers
short of a length on off, drops it to backward point for a well-judged run
short of good length, slanted across on off, pulled to midwicket
short ball, crunches a pull through square leg, the fielder in the deep is backward and he gets around it but the ball bounces n front
backs away and reaches out for an outside edge down to third man
short of a length, punched with an open face to deep backward point
backs away and carves this one over short third man off the outside part of the bat. Opens the face very late
full on the pads, swept down to deep fine leg
gets down for a reverse sweep but it's to the wrong length. A bit of bounce results in a top-edge that's taken at short third man
floated up and dipping on middle, pushed back
full on leg, defended
stays back to a length ball and opens the face to short third man
just over short cover. Watson advances down the ground and creams this over the fielder to the sweeper cover fence
short of a length on middle, defended
short of a length outside off, guided to point
short of a length on off, punches to the left of cover who makes a diving save and a direct hit would have made things tight at the keeper's end
fullish on middle and off, defended back

dropped. That's an unbelievable drop. seemed until the very end that he had taken it. Watson swivels around and got a top-edge on this pull. And the fielder in the deep runs in from square leg and takes the catch. Then he gets down and rolls over. Just as he's completing the roll, the ball pops out. Held it for a good couple of seconds but just as he was completing a tumble. They refer it upstairs and it's not out
that's flown off the top-edge. Short of good length, angling in and completely tucking him up. Forces a pull and the ball goes over deep fine leg way back into the stands
short on middle, rocks back and hammers a pull past midwicket
stays back to a length ball that spins in from outside off and takes the inside edge of Watson's bat
flattens the trajectory and Vince charges down the ground and blindly swipes across the line. Think it was the wrong'un. Gets beaten and the keeper competes a simple stumping. Well-bowled
slanted across at a back of a length, beats the punch and nearly shaves the outside edge
beaten outside off again
full on leg, defended
short, fetches a pull from outside off and drags it to mid-off
short, pulled through square leg
short of a length outside off, guided to point
swings early on the pull and misses
short ball, nudges it towards short fine leg
short of a length outside off, slashes an outside edge to third man
full on the pads, clipped away to backward square leg
too short and sitting up nicely, Watson picks it early and shifts back before muscling a pull over deep midwcicket
fuller, drilled away to deep square leg
stays back and punches a length ball to the right of the bowler
fuller, carved away through the covers
stands tall and punches this down the ground
short of a length on off, punched into the covers
short of a length outside off, mistimes a pull over midwicket
. Coleman again, this time he puts down a sitter. Short ball, Watson is rushed into a pull and Coleman rushes into it with hard hands and lets it pop out
rushes in to catch another pull but the ball drops short
fullish, slower outside off, whipped into the leg side
back of a length, punched to mid-off
short of a length, angled across outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
short, tries to pull and misses
whips a fuller ball off the inside of the bat to square leg
short and sitting up nicely on middle and off, pulled muscularly a good fifteen rows into the deep midwicket stands
short of a length, slanted across, slaps it over mid-off inside the circle
full, slower ball, Watson goes for a big heave and skies it in the air off the splice. Lands short of sweeper cover rushing forward
back of a length, angling into him, tucked up and he squeezes it out behind square on the leg side
short ball, could have been the slower one and Green drags a pull straight to mid-off. What an antithetical innings from Green to the rest of the Thunder batting performance! Four off 13
short over middle, gets under it
short and wide, slapped through point and sweeper gets around and slides to his left to pull it back
full on the pads, clipped uppishly between midwicket and long-on. Beats both fielders into the boundary
walks across and swats this fullish length ball away with a neat paddle over the keeper. One-bounce over fine leg
is that the game? Yes, it is. Short of a length, angling into leg and he tries to pull. But he's tucked up and the ball goes off the pad to deep fine leg
